intro: Sarojusticia kempeana subsp. muelleri, commonly known as the Mueller's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent leaves and deep root system. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapes and conservation areas.
